intro: Pavetta tisserantii, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cymes and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature, contributing to its dispersal in natural habitats.
